title: Spack sometimes ignores packages.yaml?
body:
On my Mac I added the following entry in my ```spack/etc/packages.yaml```
```
  pkg-config:
    compiler: [clang]
```
in the hope of ```spack``` now always relying on a clang-build ```pkg-config```. However I get
```
$ spack spec hdf5
Input spec
--------------------------------
hdf5

Normalized
--------------------------------
hdf5
    ^zlib@1.1.2:

Concretized
--------------------------------
hdf5@1.10.1%gcc@7.2.0+cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+pic+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
    ^numactl@2.0.11%gcc@7.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
        ^autoconf@2.69%gcc@7.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
            ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@7.2.0+sigsegv arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
                ^libsigsegv@2.11%gcc@7.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
        ^automake@1.15%gcc@7.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
        ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@7.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
    ^openmpi@3.0.0%gcc@7.2.0~cuda fabrics= ~java schedulers= ~sqlite3~thread_multiple+vt arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
        ^hwloc@1.11.7%gcc@7.2.0~cuda+libxml2~pci arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
            ^libxml2@2.9.4%gcc@7.2.0~python arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
                ^pkg-config@0.29.2%gcc@7.2.0+internal_glib arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
                ^xz@5.2.3%gcc@7.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64 
                ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@7.2.0+pic+shared arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64
```
and ```pkg-config``` doesn't build on Mac with ```gcc```.
Am I using ```packages.yaml``` wrong or is the concretisation buggy?
